column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Samples.
#Text=Polycrystalline samples with the composition Sn50−xAsxSe50 (x = 0, 0.05, 0.5, and 2.5) were prepared by high-temperature reactions.
#Text=Samples were synthesized from the stoichiometric mixtures of the 5 N elements (Sn and Se) and the compound (AsSn, synthesized).
#Text=The AsSn compound was prepared by heating the stoichiometric mixture of Sn (5 N) and As (three times sublimed) at 933 K for 14 days in a vacuum-sealed (∼10−3 Pa) quartz ampoule.
#Text=Synthesis of the samples was done in evacuated quartz ampoules by heating the stoichiometric mixture (1.7 K/min) up to 1223 K.
#Text=Ampoules were kept at this temperature for 6 h followed by free cooling to room temperature in the turned-off furnace.
#Text=The resulting bulk materials were powdered in agate mortar and hot-pressed at 713 K and 80 MPa for 1 h in a graphite die.
#Text=The sample with the highest x was hot-pressed at a lower temperature (633 K) to keep suitable mechanical properties.
#Text=Compact disc-shaped samples (with diameter 25 mm and thickness ∼4 mm) reached 89−96% of the theoretical density.
#Text=These discs were consequently used as targets for PLD.
#Text=Sn50−xAsxSe50 thin films were obtained via PLD.
#Text=Chalcogenide targets were ablated with a KrF excimer laser emitting at 248 nm using 125 (±3) mJ output pulse energies, 30 ns pulse duration, and 20 Hz repetition rate.
#Text=Laser energy density was set at ∼2 J/cm2 .
#Text=The thin films were deposited in a vacuum chamber (the pressure during deposition: (5.7 × 10−6 )−(1.6 × 10−5 ) Pa, background pressure: 4.2−(5 × 10−6 Pa)).
#Text=To obtain films with good thickness uniformity, the off-axis PLD technique exploiting rotating substrates and targets was used.
#Text=Rotation speeds were ∼5°/min for both targets and substrates.

#Text=Pieces of single-crystalline ⟨100⟩ oriented silicon wafers (boron doped, p-type; thickness 0.525 mm; resistivity 75−95 Ω cm) and microscope glass slides (10 mm × 10 mm) were used as substrates; these were mounted parallel to the target surface at a distance of 6 cm.
#Text=The temperature of the substrates was not controlled.
#Text=The duration of the PLD process was chosen to fabricate thin films with a thickness of ∼170−180 nm.
